greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = 1 + a(A256992(n)).
comment: Number of iterations of A256992 needed to reach one when starting from n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: Other observations. For all n >= 1 it holds that:
Also it seems that a(n) - A070939(n) = -1, 0 or +1 for all n >= 1. [Compare A256991 and A256992 to see the connection.]
It is also very likely that a(n) <= A071542(n) for all n.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 15 2015
